channel.title: Githubpages on Joe Jean | Software Engineer
channel.description: Recent content in Githubpages on Joe Jean | Software Engineer

item.title: Moving My Personal Website from Heroku to Github Pages
item.description: When I first built my personal website I deployed it to Heroku. At that time Heroku was the best option for me because it offered a free tier and it was relatively easy to use. But one thing I did not like about it was that the application dyno—the container that handles all the HTTP traffic to the site— would go to sleep if my website receives no traffic in a 30-minute period.
